Reviews.Title: “perfect if you know paris”
Reviews.Author: norfolk23
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for one night on my way through paris. The hotel had been personally recommended and the TA reviews clinched it. I thought it was great and did not suffer from any noise issues even though I was on the 2nd floor. It is small so if space is a requirement this may not be the hotel your looking for. In addition, I would suggest this hotel as suitable for visitors that know Paris and are looking for something different. The area is great for young paris but may not be so suitable if your looking for shopping and sightseeing ops. Metro is not that close either but it is a lovely hotel with a nice vibe in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, lovely people”
Reviews.Author: M00se_and_Squirrel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a week ago and were so impressed. The rooms are small, but the views of the canal are great. Breakfast is perfect, but what really makes le citizen stand apart is the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Day and night, you are looked after and everyone is so lovely, it makes you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: JenandTomandMonty
Reviews.Content: they give u an ipad while u r here. the whole minibar is free. breakfast is free. the door girl is super friendly and speaks perfect english. at breakfast they squeeze. u fresh oj right there. what more do u want? it is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on canal st. martin”
Reviews.Author: ABunzl
Reviews.Content: Who knew you could stay in the 10th arrondissement? My new favorite area in paris to eat, drink, shop and stroll. The hotel was lovely - the people who worked there were incredible nice and friendly. For Paris, or any city for that matter, the rooms were a great size. And again, the location is great. Free ipads, mini bar, breakfast - fun, unique and much appreciated! The beds were very comfortable as well. Not a luxury hotel but a well priced, very well located great find. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly deserves all its praise”
Reviews.Author: phofmann
Reviews.Content: Having read the outstanding Tripadvisor reviews, I secured a fully pre-paid five-night reservation at Le Citizen in Mar 2012. My fifth or sixth trip to Paris, this was the first time I stayed this far east, outside of the more touristy areas of the centre. I'm reluctant to share this glowing review because I want Le Citizen to be a well-kept secret. Its current #4 standing amongst thousands of reviewed Paris hotels is very well-deserved and I hope their growing popularity doesn't change their values. Le Citizen's motto,"run by a team whose ultimate goal is that guests enjoy every moment of their visit," is absolutely genuine. They cater to your every question, satisfy every request, and make your stay effortless and enjoyable. Basically everything is free: the wifi, the use of a personal well-equipped iPad during your stay, all the snacks and drinks in your room, the sensational breakfasts with homemade yogurts, preserves, local breads, strong espresso, and freshly pressed juices made to order. They happily printed my documents. They happily answered all my questions. I stayed in the smaller City Room. Like most Paris hotels, room space is limited, but I admired the clever space-saving design, the high-quality finishings, the exceptional bedding and shower, and the bright airiness that comes from three west-facing openable windows overlooking Canal St Martin. A secret if you have more than one suitcase: place one in the clever space beneath the bathroom sink. If I had to fault anything: perhaps the loud revellers hanging out on the canal late into Friday night. But this wasn't the hotel's fault, just a gritty character of this magical, untouristy part of the city. Having stayed here on a business trip, I'm eagerly looking forward to staying here again for a holiday with my partner. To everyone at Le Citizen, un grand merci!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable sojourn”
Reviews.Author: anne9837
Reviews.Content: 2 nights in this excellent hotel with all that you need. We took a larger room which was on the first floor no.11; it overlooked the canal so very good for people watching from your room. Well equpped bathroom, with a bath- good slection of amenities; kettle for tea, fridge with some drinks as well as some snacks - all included. Breakfast was included and very good - fresh orange juice, lovely choice of breads- and if you want that homely touch - a toaster. A 15 minute walk from Gard du Nord- nice neighbourhood and slightly off the beaten track. For something different do try ity you will not be disappointed. Good restaurant recomendations and very helpful and friendly assistance from reception.

Reviews.Title: “Le Citizen Hotel, Paris”
Reviews.Author: Kelly V
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Paris for our honeymoon. We stayed 4 nights in Le Citizen hotel and got a free upgrade on our last night. Everyone in this hotel is warm and friendly, even the owner, Sofie. We would specifically like to recognize and send our compliments to John and Laura for taking good care of us. They have been very helpful and went the extra mile to ensure that all of our needs were met. The location of the hotel is in the not so touristy part of town so we got a feel of how the locals lived like which we found very interesting and appealing. The nearest metro station is just a 7 minute walk away which we found very convenient. The rooms are nice and clean and price is not too bad. We highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Parisian Experience”
Reviews.Author: FranWorld
Reviews.Content: LE CITIZEN My wife and I travel extensively for work and pleasure. So we have seen our fair share of hotels and resorts throughout the world. If you love Paris and prefer to stay somewhere off the beaten path yet immersed in the Parisian culture, then LE CITIZEN will be ideal for you. First and foremost, the hospitality is amazing. We bonded with the staff immediately. Pierre, Laure, John, Mario, and Fatu took great care of us from check in to check out. We stayed in Room no. 66 which is on the top floor offering a gorgeous western view of the city. You’ll be enchanted by the Parisian rooftops and you can just make out the Eiffel Tower’s rotating light at night. The room itself is a nice size. Very clean, minimal with a modern Ikea design which I prefer to overly ornate. We travel with not only our suitcases but also our TV production equipment and we found the room to be quite spacious. The all-important bed is king sized and you will melt right to sleep because it’s too comfortable. Zero neck or back pain. There’s plenty of natural light. A clean bathroom with ample hot water and good water pressure. You have a small desk to work on. The hotel even lends you an iPad which is tricked out with newspapers, magazines, and apps to help you enjoy the neighborhood as well as Paris in general. What I love too is the little dining area where there is always a baked treat and sparking water waiting for you when you return home each day. I also read reviews complaining about the noise outside. I live in NYC so I am accustomed to the fact that the city will never be as quietly serene as the countryside. Outside sounds goes with the territory when visiting a major city like Paris. The lobby is an intimate modern café offering plenty of nice reading material, a view of the canal, and the breakfast (which comes with the room rate) is just perfect. The staff fresh squeezes juice, makes eye opening espressos, and offers a good selection of sweet and savory bites which they are happy to warm up for you if you ask. I read one review that wasn’t very positive about the breakfast. But being a discerning foodie from Manhattan, I found it to be delectable. There’s a bakery nearby but I was completely satisfied dining on the many choices in the hotel. It’s situated next to a lovely tree-lined canal making you feel as if you are in the movie, Amelie. There are nice (and authentic) restaurants and boutique shops all within walking distance. And plenty of taxis along with a train station that’s close by. We used the subway quite a lot, taking us to all the major sights. If you’ve been to Paris before and want an alternative, charming experience, then I highly recommend LE CITIZEN. You’ll feel right at home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Bissboy
Reviews.Content: We Booked on the strength of tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed. We stayed for one night only, on arrival we met a very friendly member of staff who told us we had been upgraded! Our room was large (for Paris) had an excellent king size bed, great shower and lovely view of the canal. It was very trendily decorated and I could have whiled away an extra day or two there quite easily. Each room came with an I-pad which had pre-recorded links about restraunts and bars nearby and guides to Paris. It was a very nice touch, as was the complementary mini-bar with high quality snacks/drinks. Complimentary breakfast was also excellent. The staff were also extremely friendly and helpful. Having stayed in other hotels in Paris, this easily represents the best value for money I've had. I would highly recommend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome from helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: A_and_M_Allen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and from arrival when we were given a cup of tea/coffee in the eating area to when we picked up our bags after a day's sightseeing before we left Paris, every member of staff we met treated us as valued guests and were friendly and helpful. Our canal facing room was quiet and we enjoyed watching the lock at work. The metro is nearby and therefore easy to access. The room was as small as the hotel website mentions and as we had expected, but was well appointed and really comfortable. The shower was wonderful and we enjoyed the nice little touches like use of an Ipad and a free mini bar which included good quality fruit juice and diet coke. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value and amazing staff in a rather remote location”
Reviews.Author: Georgy D
Reviews.Content: I saw Le citizen ranked high on tripadvisor and decided to stay there. I read quite a bit on Canal St. Martin and wanted to experience it first hand. NOTE: if that's your first time in Paris and you are staying for a short time, I would not recommend the location, because it is rather remote, so you'll spend quite a bit of time getting places. Otherwise: the staff if AMAZING, especially for Paris. Knowledgeable, nice, obliging. Reservations, recommendations, advice - they've got it. I would especially like to note the reception desk guy John, he was very friendly and quite patient with me. Rooms: I stayed in room 33, hardly a suite as advertised, but incredible view, good design, and - for 235 euros a night a real delight, best value I've seen in Paris so far in my 20 more times in the city. Location: quite remote, but you can enjoy the neighborhood, and the Republique metro that will take you to most Paris neighborhoods is nearby. Overall atmosphere: homey and hip at the same time. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Best things come in small packages”
Reviews.Author: MikeAndVal_1031
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were greeted by Laure and thus began our wonderful experience at Le Citizen Hotel. While the room was small, everything was efficiently laid out and comfortable, especially the bed. The entire staff was so friendly and helpful that the extra few minutes it took to organize our things were quickly forgotten. After a very restful night, the area is very quiet at night and the canal is charming, we went down to the Hotel Cafe' which is for guests only and were served an array of delicious breakfast items all included in the price of the room. As for location, we were able to walk or easily reach a metro that would take us everywhere in the city. We would recommend this hotel to everyone except for those who travel with lots of luggage and expect large rooms. To those I say, "be prepared to spend much more for the same experience."

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: MMMG2012
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here. This exquisite place is like home away from home. We arrived at noon time, located the address. It was on small but busy street. The door was tight shut. We rang the door bell. A gentleman in black rimmed glasses answered the door with a warm “bonjour” and big smile. A couple steps up, we entered the small reception area. Immediately coffee was brought to us. He started to chat with us like an old friend while checking us in. His relaxing manner put us at ease and made us feel at home right away. Our room was on the top floor. We were initially surprised and a bit disappointed by the tiny space. We did not expect the room to be that small. After a day here, we found out that actually size did not matter. Everything needed was at your fingertip, compact and right where you needed. Nice shower, all the toiletry necessities, reusable bottles of drinking water, small snacks, phone calls, everything a traveler may need was available, all free of charge! The room was simply decorated, but with quality. The floor window was draped with beautiful cotton curtains. The bed linens were of the best quality, clean, soft, fresh and new. So comfortable that it felt like a shower room in IKEA. As we were new to Paris, we had questions about navigating the area and planning for meals. The staff was always so extremely patient recommending places and restaurants to us, like a family friend. Sometimes in doubt, they would go online, google for us and print out the map for us. We were offered an IPAD, which we thought was a great idea, but we had our laptops with us which was enough. I did not think free breakfast was included as we never had breakfast here. After 3 days here, we felt almost attached to this little cozy hotel. What a little haven this tiny hotel is! It is home away from home for any travelers! After Paris, we flew to Courchevel, supposedly the world’s most expensive ski resort and stayed at a fancy hotel at Courchevel 1850. I am sorry to say, Le Citizen is more superior in every possible way in its unpretentious and unassuming manner!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MonsieurQuick
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for one night last week. The service was outstanding. We checked in early at 1pm and the friendly staff immediately brought tea to our room to welcome us. Our city room has great views over the canal and was modern and well-equipped. It was immaculately clean. We were also given an ipad to use during our stay. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with a couple of caveats”
Reviews.Author: bpch
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Citizen and would return, although we'd probably stay in a cheaper room. The best thing about the hotel is the superb staff, who are earnest and eager to help you. In our experience, such service is relatively uncommon in Paris! Our room (a more expensive Zen suite) was spacious and thoughtfully un-froufrou. Great bed with duvet, good pillows. Nice bathroom. Overall the design is smart, except for the slightly peculiar, modular, window banquette, which is uncomfortable and can get in the way of closing the curtains. There were lots of windows. It's worth bearing in mind that the hotel is located near a crossroads and that the traffic can be noisy, meaning you don't actually want to open the room windows if you want some quiet. (Perhaps this is less of a problem on higher floors.) The only real disappointment was the included breakfast, but we might be pickier than most people -- in our opinion, since there are many great bakeries in Paris, a hotel could offer really good, fresh pastries and bread. In terms of location, the hotel is a decent walk away from some of the more exciting restaurants clustered in the 11th but very close to everything by metro.

Reviews.Title: “Good2go”
Reviews.Author: Furtado2
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great location with nice shops and good restaurants. Personeel spreekt nederlands dus erg makkelijk. Weekend tip!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff fantastic rooms and interesting location”
Reviews.Author: JSJJMelbourne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and 2 teenage boys stayed for 3 nights in the apartment which is a city room and suite combined. We have been to Paris quite a few times and wanted to experience something local and non touristy. This is the spot. The staff could not have done more, the rooms were really comfortable and well furnished and I have finally had a great shower in Paris. If you want to see all the sights you are 2 minutes from the Metro. Free internet and phone calls is a nice touch and the staff are really interesting to chat to. The canal has a working loch right outside the hotel and it's interesting watching boats go by. You can walk or run along the canal for ages and find cafes and markets easily. Really great!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: JimmmmmyB
Reviews.Content: Great service, Great Rooms, Great Location. It was an absolute pleasure staying here and would definitely stay again ! Highly Recommended. The staff go out of their way for you, and make you feel right at home. Fantastic. And the food!!!!! WOW

Reviews.Title: “The perfect marriage of the practical and the sensual.”
Reviews.Author: FirBolag
Reviews.Content: Le Citizen does not have a health club,a bar,a pretentious atmosphere with a cold unfriendly staff .Le Citizen does have wonderfully comfortable beds, thoughtful and beautiful design,and a warm friendly helpful staff. The location is out of a dream. To experience the Canal St Martin first thing in the morning or at the end of a satisfying evening is a poignant reminder that at least for now the city of lights is home.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Longtonian
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, off the tourist trail, but with many of the main attractions easily accessible on foot or by metro. Turn right and then up the hill and you can walk up to Belleville; authentic Paris, Piaf's birthplace, a bit seedy but interesting. The Hotel du Nord restaurant, just a couple of minutes walk away, has a great atmosphere with reasonable food. Pink Flamingo, just round the corner serves excellent pizza. As for the hotel itself, our room (number 1, I think) was tiny. We just took hand luggage but still had trouble finding somewhere to put our stuff. It would have been impossible with a large case. However, the bed was very comfortable and the room modern and clean. Our window looked out onto a set of traffic lights by the Canal, and it was a little noisy, but nothing too troublesome. The provision of an Ipad was a nice touch. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Given the size of the room though I think the hotel is a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: apalie
Reviews.Content: It's impossible to decide which aspect of our stay was more enjoyable: the room itself (Zen Suite - worth every penny), or our conversations with Pierre, Sophie, and Fatou. I could not have imagined a better atmosphere, a more pleasant experience. The room oozed style and comfort, despite being quite compact - a rare achievement. I admit, we didn't eat breakfast here. Why would you, when there's a brilliant bakery a couple of minutes' walk from the hotel? We spent plenty of time in our room, though, gazing out the windows, reading, and wishing we could stay another night or two. The use of the iPad as part of your stay is a stroke of brilliance, which I'm sure will become the norm at upscale hotels. Apparently some guests complain about the neighbourhood, which is perhaps a bit "real" for the tastes of some tourists, but I wouldn't call it gritty, and certainly not unsafe. The metro is close, but we walked nearly everywhere. Plenty of nice food nearby, even grocery stores, which we found useful. If you're the type of person who needs total luxury in all aspects of your travel, then stay elsewhere, because yes, there are homeless people in this neighbourhood. This is reality. If you don't want to bury your head in the sand, and instead want to experience a little something of actual Parisian life, stay at Le Citizen and be amazed at how perfectly brilliant it is. Arguably one of my best hotel experiences yet.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy & Personal Neighborhood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: awright519
Reviews.Content: The Le Citizen is a gem of a hotel in a wonderful neighborhood that is off the beaten path but still close to everything with a short walk or jump on the Metro. While our room was a tad smaller than your normal Parisian hotel, what set Le Citizen apart was the staff. From the moment we arrived and were greeted by Pierre, we knew we were staying somewhere special. They had wonderful recommendations for what to do and where to eat (my husband is still raving about L'As Du Fallafel). As we were staying here as part of our honeymoon, they also helped dear friends organize a truly magical night for us - a nighttime car tour of the city and a delicious and perfect Parisian bistro dinner. They were so thoughtful and thorough, making sure the night was truly special for us. You can tell that Le Citizen is a labor of love and in a city like Paris with so many choices of where to stay, the personal touch is what sets the truly special places apart. We only stayed in Paris 2 nights and after our stay at Le Citizen, we were wishing we'd been able to stay much longer.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, Fresh and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: WRS W
Reviews.Content: One of those places where reality equals the advertisement photos. Rooms are tastily modernist and clean to a fault. This was the perfect place to arrive at after a long night's flight into Paris with its freshness. Location is within easy access of the Metro and all the "must-do" locations of Paris, yet without feeling like you are part of the tourist pilgrimage 24/7. The staff were very friendly and helpful and you instantly felt at home. Being next to the canal, which opens out to a public green space also provides the outlet for some outdoor activity.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary!”
Reviews.Author: Clinton-and-Sarah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Citizen for five nights in late November and for our last day in Europe in December. The hotel immediately struck us as modern (the owner mentioned it opened last year) with sharp, distinctive modernist design principles underpinning the two rooms we stayed in. Both the Zen Suite and the City L Room were spacious, particularly for central Paris, as well as being warm and a welcome respite from a day of sightseeing. The shower in the Zen Suite was particularly enjoyable and the soft, comfortable beds ensured a very sound sleep. Location wise, Le Citizen appealed to us because it is situated in a good area where the locals live, work and dine. Going to see all the usual tourist sights is not problematic because the hotel is a 5 minute stroll from the Paris Metro (Jacques Bonsergent Station) - and it is a very picturesque stroll indeed. The service and hospitality was best of all - the day concierge Pierre happily welcomed us in English, attended to our every request and engaged us in great conversation. Everyone else was supportive and friendly, with both owners going out of their way to make sure we were comfortable. We cannot speak too highly of the service offered, particularly given we were in the capital of the Francophile world, speaking mainly English! We genuinely enjoyed everyone's company and at times it almost felt like we were staying with familiar friends. In summary, this is a superior hotel with great design principles, location and, above all, service. We got engaged in Paris and hope to stay at Le Citizen again for our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and price”
Reviews.Author: FraBos
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel during a very busy week end in December. I was not able to find a good hotel with a proper price and then I found Le Citizen. I must say that the reviews are all correct! Big room (we had a Zen Suite) not too expensive price. Clean, well decorated. Kind people at the front desk. We did not try the breakfast because we were too late every morning. Perfect location, close to a Metro station and in a very live area. The only downsize is the noise. The street is very loud even in the middle of the night and you can also hear everything people do and say in the rooms upstair and next door. I must say my husband slept like a baby and I would have been able to do the same with a pair of hearplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Largest and best room we've ever had in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: RoquebrunRocks
Reviews.Content: We loved this boutique hotel for many reasons. It is chic but unpretentious. We were warmly welcomed and looked after. The room was spacious with a gorgeous bath! We have already booked our return. Great location in a very Parisian district, not overly touristique. The iPad in the room was a great touch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff.”
Reviews.Author: Craigflower
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in October and could not have been happier with this hotel. There are only twelve rooms which allows one to establish a very personal relationship with the front desk staff all or whom are friendly, courteous and very helpful. The location is just what we wanted - away from the tourist throngs but just five minutes away from the Metro (subway). A ten-minute Metro ride gets you right into the centre of Paris. The feeling in the neighbourhood is "local" in the sense that there are few tourists which allows you a chance to see how average Parisians go about their daily lives. There are very good restaurants in the area. All in all it's a splendid hotel in a lovely location. We would recommend it highly to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tommy D
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic 2 nights at Le Citizen. The staff are very friendly and helpful and made everything very easy for us. Right on the canal, the hotel is modern, and very comfortable. We had a great meal 30 metres away at Hotel Du Nord, and there are some other cool bars and eateries in the area. The proximity is really good, 10 mins from the Gare Du Nord. We walked from the hotel to Notre Dame (30 mins) on Saturday morning, and to the stylish Marais District on the Sunday in 20 mins. You can't go wrong with Le Citizen

Reviews.Title: “Romantic canalside weekend”
Reviews.Author: Rod L
Reviews.Content: A very stylish hotel with unusual [for Paris] canalside location Great use of plywood veneers to give a Nordic feel Very relaxing

Reviews.Title: “First time in Paris and a warm welcome from Le Citizen”
Reviews.Author: BertSingapore
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris for work and extended my stay at Le Citizen for three nights in a dreary late November 2011. But staying at the Le Citizen made it all better. The key thing that made a difference were the receptionists Pierre and Fatoumata, who were both friendly and welcoming to an extent that I found quite rare. They were efficient when seeing to my needs and yet were happy to chat and warmly share their views and experiences about Paris as locals when there was time between seeing to the needs of other guests. Some of their views were refreshingly frank and unvarnished, without being overbearing. I found it gratifying to be able to look forward to seeing a friendly face before leaving to explore the city and after a long day walking the streets and seeing the sights. Having seen my share of indifferent faces and grudging service in other (even much more expensive) establishments, this is not something that I take for granted. The hotel itself is spotless. My room was very clean and it was quite bright, with that soft temperate climate light coming in from its bank of five windows (Zen suite fourth floor). There was also quite an atmospheric view of the canal and the ironwork bridges. In terms of facilities and toiletries, it had everything I needed, from decent storage space, a safe, a large bathtub and separate WC area, moisturising oil etc. There was some traffic noise at night as the hotel is just by the street, but it didn't bother me and I slept quite soundly. In fact, I rather enjoyed watching the goings on around the canal banks from the room. This was because Le Citizen isn't in a very touristy neighbourhood, which I liked, because it allows a more intimate observation of the day to day life of the actual daily lives of people who live in Paris. This however, may not be to the taste of others who are averse to a city's more mundane intrusions while on holiday, and who want the major sights and conveniences right at their doorstep. On that point, Paris appears to be a town that lends itself to walking, and it should be accepted that one should be prepared to do so. In that context, I found Le Citizen to be quite convenient to the sights, with the Marais, Place des Vosges etc within easy walkable distance. The Place de Republique station, which is an important interchange between several metro lines, was even nearer (10 mins brisk walk or so). I never felt cut off or put off by distance in visiting the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower etc. The hotel's lounge and breakfast was airy and welcoming and I enjoyed the continental breakfast that the hotel offered, which included several different types of jams, cakes, yoghurt, fruits, pastries etc. But those who need a hearty and hot American style breakfast with bacon, sausages etc may have to look elsewhere in the neighbourhood, which thankfully has a decent number of nearby cafes and bistros etc. Oh yes, there is a lot of reading material in the breakfast lounge, including lots of up-to-date Paris guide books. You may not even need to bring your own. All in all, I was pleased with the hotel. If you need business amenities, a pool and gym, i.e., a full service hotel, then Le Citizen may not meet your needs. But I would unreservedly recommend it to anyone who wants a small, clean, well designed place with warm service, just a bit off the beaten path. I certainly look forward to going back myself. Oh yes, if you have substantial luggage, and are part of a group, do yourself a favour - avail yourself of the hotel's airport transfer. The convenience and avoidance of hassle is well worth the 50 euro cost.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: Rarely am I moved to write positive reviews but Le Citizen just gets everything right. Staff are professional, interesting people with good knowledge of Paris and particularly the surrounding area, and they have great recommendations for restaurants. Hotel itself is modern, well decked out, breakfast is simple but high quality, and agree with previous reviews that the I-pad is a nice touch – I had a I-phone with me so didn’t think I’d need it, how wrong I was. We stayed in the zen suite on the 6th floor and it was a very well-designed space, with comfy bed, good shower etc. The location is perfect: it’s far enough away from the tourist trail so you feel like you have your own space and are able to explore a bit of ‘normal’ Paris, but near enough to walk to the Marais, Notre Dame etc; it’s also not far from Republique which has a number of Metro lines. Thanks Le Citizen.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: katrineCPH
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in October with husband and 10 year old daughter. The hotel arranged for us to be picked up at the airport. Arriving in Paris quite late this was a truly easy and wonderful start to some lovely days in Paris! We had the Zen suite, which was perfect for us. We loved the interior design and especially the large windows with a beautiful view of Canal St Martin. The room had a super comfy double bed (we slept like babies every night!), and a third bed was made up for our daughter in front of a window, she really liked that. The bathroom was clean and spacious. We liked that the hotel owner tries in every way to be environmental conscious, meaning that shampoo and conditioner did not come in small bottles but from large dispensers in the shower. The location suited us very well - we are not into the boulevards and shopping in Place Vendome is not our thing. We really liked all the lovely small shops and cafes, wine bars and restaurants that surrounded the hotel - this is true Paris to us. Metro station close by and walking distance to Marais. The staff are all very nice and friendly and made a restaurant booking at VIVANT for us (go there, you will not regret it!!). We did not ask for much advice, but I am sure that if we had asked they would do their absolute best to answer any question about Paris that we might have. We had breakfast in the dining room every day, very delicious and reasonably priced. I cannot praise this hotel enough. Small, friendly, personal, great location, beautiful interiors - what more can you wish for? We can honestly say that we will never consider staying anywhere else on future trips to Paris! Thanks, Sophie and staff, for 6 wonderful days! PS: Lots of great places to eat and drink around the hotel. We LOVED Verre Volee right across the canal. Also liked Hotel du Nord, Cafe Sesame, Les Enfants Perdus, Chez Prune and the super bakery at the end of Rue de Marseille - Du Pain et Des Idées. Try the escargot with figs - excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Le Citizen - Great Location, Comfortable Rooms & Super Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kbe77e
Reviews.Content: Le Citizen was the perfect place to stay for our 3 nights in Paris. The rooms were clean & comfortable, the staff were very helpful in recommending & booking restaurants etc, & the location was perfect! Thanks for making our stay in Paris truly enjoyable :) Oh I nearly forgot - the breakfast that they have available is fantastic!! - Great coffees, cereals, freshly make yoghurt, bread, pastries & freshly squeezed orange juice - perfection!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and chic boutique hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Beaks08
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel last weekend as a celebration treat for my birthday. Arriving from Gare du Nord the hotel was located on two stops away on the metro and was very easy to find. With a slightly longer walking distance, the hotel was also located very near to the stop 'Republique' which had several metro lines all travelling to the central locations. At the hotel we were staying in the Zen suite located on the 5th floor which was very spacious and clean. The suite had a beautiful view overlooking the canal which could be seen by the extremely large and comfortable bed. The large shower head was excellent and the eco-friendly products were a lovely plus. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful all week, even when we arrived back to the hotel around 4am. Our flights were not until the evening on the day which we checked out but we were able to keep our baggage at the hotel until the evening and were also invited to have drinks in the hotel even though we had already checked out. The complimentary ipad for the duration of our stay was also a great bonus! All in all an excellent and memoriable weekend with thanks to this lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for a birthday celebration. The hotel is small but chic being recently refurbished overlooking the St Martin canal. We had booked the city k room which is spacious with the most enormous bed I've ever slept in - 200cm wide as well as a couple of armchairs and a desk and chair - the storage space is just adequate for a short stay. The bathroom is well equipped with a range of cosmetics and a deep bath, there is a huge shower head which was very powerful but difficult to use as it can only be used hand-held and as it's powerful it's easy to flood the bathroom. A bonus was being able to walk from Gard du Nord (and Eurostar) to the hotel - about 15 minutes, so not a trip to do with a lot of luggage but we just had small bags. We had breakfast in the hotel - a range of granola, fruit, yoghurt, croissants and bread with a lot of home made jams and cakes. Fresh orange juice and coffee or tea to drink. Stylish coffee table type books are in the bedrooms and breakfast rooms. The staff are very friendly and helpful and will go out of their way to help, whether it's pre-booking a trip up the Eiffel Tower or a dinner reservation. We liked the area a lot - very young and buzzy. We had early evening beer in Cafe Prune and ate in Cafe Jennapes and L'Atmosphere - both good. We found everything quite expensive but the pound/euro exchange rate isn't good at the moment. As others have said the complimentary ipad was very useful - a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Le Citizen - bad lasting impression”
Reviews.Author: claire s
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked Le Citizen as we were after a mellow September weekend break around Canal St Martin and Le Marais. The location is fantastic and the staff all really helpful during the booking and on arrival. We loved the ipad offer and first impressions were excellent. On our last night my boyfriend got food poisoning really badly, we'd eaten something different as I was in the first 3 months of pregnancy and only wanting to eat very simple food (a bit annoying when in Paris!). Anyway on our final day we tried to check out but he was so ill and weak he could hardly walk and needed to be both near a bathroom and lying down - we had no choice but to check back into the room. The room wasn't booked but the hotel rather unsympathetically charged us at least 75% full rate...while saying "oh we feel like we're taking advantage of you"...I was feeling sick with morning sickness and my boyfriend white as a sheet no neither had the energy to say "well you are!". We were happy to pay as the room had been cleaned but I thought a 40-50% room rate charge would have been kinder. It was a shame really because we were about to recommend Le Citizen to all our friends. Bad lasting impression.

Reviews.Title: “Chic little hotel in an excellent spot”
Reviews.Author: Steens2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights at the end of July. The staff was very welcoming, friendly and helpful and our room, the Zen Suite, was fabulous. The bed, bathroom, everything was top quality, and the the shower deserves a special mention. The location of the hotel is convenient for getting around the city via metro and is atmospheric and worth exploring in its own right. There are lots of interesting restaurants within easy walking distance. On warm evenings people picnic along the canal. We will definitely stay here again when next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoTraveler4444
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Le Citizen in Paris in September along with another couple. I had heard about the hotel in A NY Times article. It is located on a lovely canal in an area around the Marais. We had all been to Paris before and felt like we didn't need to be in the center of things this time. The hotel is small, I believe only 12 rooms. The rooms are small as well, but that is typical for Paris. However they are very clean and modern. The bathroom was a decent size. You get an iPad when you check in which is a nice touch. The reason to stay at this hotel however is the helpful, friendly staff. Pierre, the manager, was especially wonderful. Funny, helpful, and never too busy for us, he was one of the highlights of our stay in Paris. If we would ask for directions he would print them out off map quest and add his own personal notes. Although this hotel is out of the way, it is very close to a subway stop and we had no trouble getting to where we needed to. I highly recommend Le Citizen, especially for repeat visitors to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great little trendy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AndyJayRuss
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. We arrived in Paris by eurostar, and it only took 15 mins by tube from Gard du Nord. We stayed in a city room on the 4th floor with views over the canal. The room itself was small, but had everything you needed. The shower was amazing. The bed was even better- could have slept all day! The hotel is surrounded by cafes, patisseries, and little restaurants- all of which we used and loved! Marie et louise- a small restaurant round the corner was the highlight of our stay!! The area was full of locals, and had a real boho feel to it. I would definitely recommend staying here. Piere was very helpful and was the best receptionist we have ever encountered! Spoke perfect English, and was very funny!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern neighborhood comfort”
Reviews.Author: Andrea P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and were happy with the experience and impressed by the hotel and staff. In advance of our stay, we received a helpful email with directions and some neighborhood recommendations. We arrived via train from Gare du Nord and were able to walk to the hotel (about 15 minutes walk), but I wouldn't recommend this walk at night. We knew we were early (about 11:00 am) and were hoping they would just take our luggage. However, the service was exceptional - they had us rest and made fresh coffee and even were able to let us into our room early. The staff was all very nice and helpful and spoke English since my French was a little rusty. The room was small, which we knew, but it was very clean and they made use of all of the available nooks and crannies, so we had room for all of our stuff, but we did travel pretty lightly. A few highlights were the free internet service and Ipads, which is so helpful for planning your next day's adventures the evening before and the bathroom was thoroughly modern and had a wonderful shower. One of the best things about the hotel was the neighborhood. it's located on the beautiful canal and has a feel of a youthful, hip neighborhood which was safe and there were many choices to walk to eat and drink. We were able to escape the tourist crowds and kitsch and truly enjoy the area. We didn't feel that the location was prohibitive to seeing the museums and other sites of Paris, but we were very comfortable using the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Pengowls1
Reviews.Content: Liked the hotel and the ambience; enjoyed the breakfasts; appreciated the good-humoured friendliness of the staff; impressed by the area (despite the graffiti!) Although our room was small (as we knew beforehand), the bed and bathroom were fine- but the lights above the bed need moving as they are badly positioned! 'Le Citizen' gives the impression of an establishment that means to impress and do its best. We enjoyed ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: fabienne922
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a group of 8 Americans who wanted to practice their French, and we were so happy to find that every staff person took the trouble to have a friendly and patient conversation with us : this hotel is a very different experience from others in Paris. The rooms are very contemporary and it is clear that their decor has been very well thought out to give you the best experience possible. In addition, the breakfasts were the best I have ever had in Paris: very healthy, creative and of exquisite quality. Not the typical French ones. Overall, we loved our stay there. The welcome is just very warm, caring and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: SFfoodlover
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 days at Le Citizen Hotel in Paris for my 40th birthday. Sophie and her staff could not have been more hospitable and helpful--both before we arrived and during our stay. They helped us with dinner reservations, bike rentals, museum passes and just about everything else we needed. There is no way our trip would have been as well executed as it was if we had not had their help. The hotel is small and stylishly appointed in an off-the-beaten path location that only improves as you spend time there. The neighborhood has lots of good eats and shopping but seems relatively undiscovered by tourists. The bed was perhaps the most comfortable I have ever slept in! And the breakfast is amazing (complete with pastry from the nearby award-winning patisserie)! Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: eccossaises
Reviews.Content: Faultless. We stayed in Rm 11 which was at the front on the 1st floor. It was vey comfortable and spacious- huge comfy bed, two comfortable chairs to relax in, a table and a desk ( with it's own chair) and a roomy bathroom. Modern decor- with style -throughout and everything spotlessly clean. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast croissants and coffee were delicious and very reasonably priced. The St Martin Canal area is very picturesque with lots of shops and eateries offering traditional French cafe style food - we only had time to try 3 - the Marine, Phare and Chez Prune, and would recommend them all. 2 Metros and Gare de l'Est are all about 5 minutes walk away so anywhere in Paris is easily accessible. Some other reviewers have mentioned traffic noise and homeless people as nuisance features. This hotel is in Paris so there is traffic- but not so much as in other areas, the double glazing make a difference and after the first night we barely noticed it. Homeless people are a feature of our time and they are in every city but we truly saw very few and none of them were hassling for money. We found nothing negative about the hotel or the area and this hotel would definitely be our first choice for a return visit to Paris. It is a small hotel though - so booking well in advance probably essential.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nocedanielle
Reviews.Content: It was the best trip ever. The hotel is perfect, the service, the owner, the staff, the rooms. Everything!!! Greattttt!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Mema81
Reviews.Content: Extremely cool location with lots of restaurants, bars, clubs and life in the evening, quite and relaxing by the water during day. The hotel is very nice and fresh, with special design, somewhat "nordic" style with its wood, clean lines and cool colors. Friendly and helpful staff. Delicious breakfast. Not cheap, about double as expensive as one would pay in Sweden, for the same standard, but hey, this is Paris! Only minus point: the noise from the road (there is a street light just outside), at least for the rooms on the first floor. All in all, we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RH_83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Citizen Hotel for 3 nights and we loved it. Everything was exactly like mentioned on the website or maybe even better. ;-) The staff was extremely friendly and helpful with everything and made us really feel welcome. They did everything to meet our needs and always asked wether they could do something for us. They recommended a restaurant nearby, called "Chez Marie et Louise" and we decided to go there. The Hotel staff made a reservation for us and we were not disappointed, because we loved that restaurant. When we arrived at the hotel, our room was ready, although we arrived long before the official check-in time. Of course, this was also a bit of luck, but after we told the staff our arrival time they said that our room would be cleaned with priority. So that worked well. The hotel is located quite close to the station Gare du Nord, which is perfect, if you go to Paris by train. You can walk to Gare du Nord within approximately 15 minutes, but the staff would've also called a shuttle for us, but we didn't want that. Supermarkets are located nearby too, which we found great. And yes, it can be noisy at the Canal St. Martin, where the Hotel is located, but we didn't find it too noisy at all. That might, however, depend on what you're used to. We also live next to a street which is a bit noisy sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Jo M
Reviews.Content: Overall a really nice place to stay. Our room was very clean and very comfortable. When we first arrived we found our room quite noisey. When we mentioned this to the staff they had someone come in and fix the gaps in the windows and doors and this did make a difference. We had the hotel oganise our transfers on arrival and departure and this was a great service at a very reasonable price. The staff were very helpful with directions/dinner reservations etc. The breakfasts were really nice too, lovely fresh produce. Our only disappointment was the location of the hotel as it is quite a distance by metro from the centre of Paris and the area is a bit dodgy, especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away From Home!”
Reviews.Author: MarionClark
Reviews.Content: One feels welcome here upon arrival and during the nine days here it is always the same. The staff are like a happy family and include me and other guests in it. This is a happy place: beds are comfortable, rooms are on the small side but absolutely adequate. Light breakfast with homemade yoghurt and conserves, variety of cereals (yummy museli) plus freshly squeezed orange juice is delightful. I needed other accommodation because I extended my stay in Paris and that was found for me, also restaurants booked and taxis called. What more can I say? LOVE IT HERE AND I SHALL RETURN!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great location, excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: A_Little_Tripsy
Reviews.Content: The highlight of our stay at Le Citizen was the service we received from Pierre at reception. He was kind to us as we attempted to speak what little French we could, all the while conversing with us in English, without any negative attitude. The hotel arranged for us to be picked up at the airport, which helped ease our way into our 2-week French vacation. On our check-out day, I walked to pick up our rental car for exploring the rest of France while my wife stayed behind. Pierre kept her company with coffee in the lobby for the very long time I was delayed at the car rental location. I can't say enough about the service. We booked the largest room, and still it was quite small. The entire hotel is small. But our room was clean, interesting, and more than acceptable. The location was great, in a relatively quiet neighborhood. The walk to the nearest metro stop was 5 minutes down basically one street of restaurants and small shops - very convenient. The only negative comment we might have is that while the web site says everyone gets use of an iPad, when we arrived, one was not ready for us, and we were promised it later. We never really needed it, so we never asked, and it was never offered. Very small quibble. We would not hesitate to stay here if in Paris again. It is not fancy, but it is very comfortable, a good value, a nice location, and it was an excellent way to ease us into France.

Reviews.Title: “Our Time at Le Citizen Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: My wife, our two adult sons and I had a wonderful time at Le Citizen Hotel. This small, fun wonderfully located hotel made our trip to Paris special. In the past we have stayed in the usual neighborhoods and tourist centric spots and always had a great time. But, Le Citizen Hotel is a great place for a differant experience. Very laid back, artistic community. Just watching the canal boats go through the locks from our hotel window was special. Each day we walk down the Gallery District to the Pompideau. All in all a special visit to a wonderful City made all the more enjoyable by this tiny hotel and its staff. Michael Moore

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a romantic stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Tangovet
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel for two nights. The location is outstanding, unique, safe. It is wonderful, especially in the summer, for long evening walks along the canal, for fun restaurants and easy access to many locations. Several metro stations are located within 10 minute walk. The staff is uniquely friendly, from the pre-stay emails proposing help to transfer from the airport and to make restaurant reservation to the greeting on site and to further help with anything in Paris. The suite in which we stayed is not a suite the way Americans mean (i.e. two rooms), but a large studio, larger than typical Paris hotel room. The style is modern and the recent renovation (2010?) is of quality. The breakfast was excellent. I was born in Paris and lived in this city for many years until I emigrated to the US. While living in Paris, I never even visited this area... I strongly recommend this hotel to foreigners because of its unique near central location, the friendliness of the staff and the safety of the area. I also recommend using their airport car transfer service: it is slightly more expensive than a taxi (not even10 euros more), but the friendliness of the driver and the reliability of the service is worth more than this difference.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly modern but too far away”
Reviews.Author: kayemag1957
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is new if not almost new. We had the L suite which looked out onto the canal right on the corner. Good position. The room was lovely, spacious and spotlessly clean. Timber floors. Big windows. Bathroom was very modern but inconvenient as it is a wet room. As a result everything gets wet including the toilet and most of the floor is soaked for hours after a shower. Slippery and dangerous. Therefore, you cannot use the bathroom to either dry your hair or shave as it is too dangerous. I don't think there is a plug in the bathroom anyway. The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. They were helpful when assistance was needed in booking taxis etc. We only used the breakfast room once on our last day as we thought that 12 euros per person was expensive for coffee and croissant. You can get coffee and croissant at cafes close by for 5 euros. The bigger breakfast was delicious but of course more expensive at 20 euros per person. The location of the hotel was a problem for us, having previously stayed in the Opera District. The canal looks very beautiful in the photos on the website but in reality it is covered with graffiti. The area attracts young people who sit on the edge of the canal on warm nights and have a quiet drink. All good. But late at night the canal is a meeting place for the homeless. The restaurant close by along the canal was excellent but despite extensive searching we didn't find any other restaurant or cafe close by that was acceptable. From the website drawing we assumed that the hotel was close to the popular Marais District. We were wrong. It is a long way from the Marias district shopping and eating area and for us was too far out.

Reviews.Title: “small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: fiona h
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Le Citizen so much - our hosts were all charming, friendly and fun and really enhanced our stay - thanks guys : ) ...restaurant recommendations were spot on. All the rest has been said - small but chic rooms, great neighbourhood with everything on your doorstep, and transport links near by. We went on business and the proximity to Gare du Nord was important, only a short walk away, but until this stay we've never returned to the same hotel...but this time i think we've found our home from home .

Reviews.Title: “Funky fun and pretty well run”
Reviews.Author: Buffshot
Reviews.Content: This hotels claims to be the first real boutique hotel in Paris. It wold be churlish to deny it its claim. Certainly it is very small. Only 12 rooms, and some of them must be minute! We had a Zen room on the 3rd floor which was long and thin, but very well designed. All pale wood, comfy cushions and chairs, very comfortable bed and a good bathroom, with brushed stainless fittings. So trendy. Plenty of shelves and cupboards for a 3 day stay too. The position on a double lock on the canal St Martin adds to the trendiness of the atmosphere, but on a hot night it can be a bit noisy into the small hours (despite the double glazing). It is not correct to describe it as off the beaten track, unless perhaps you've never been to Paris before. The position is very handy for the Gare du Nord (and Gare de L'Est too) and there seem to be plenty of eateries in the neighbourhood. The Marais is only a 15 minute walk away and there are good metro lines close by. The reception service is a bit erratic, and we seemed to be greeted by a new face each time we returned. There is a very good buffet breakfast (+€12.50) served in the little dining area on the ground floor. Stools and banquettes only. The guests seemed to be mostly tourists. A good place to stay, and a welcome breath of bright modernity in what has become rather a grubby old city. The iPad is a fun gimmick, but I find it hard to believe that anyone who doesnt already travel with a laptop would really want or need one!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find!”
Reviews.Author: LeslieGarland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Citizen for 4 nights in August. We can't say enough wonderful things about this smalll, intimate hotel! It had the most modern touches with a warm family atmosphere.The staff, rooms, location...everything.....were just perfect and we loved having an ipad to use during our stay. Our room had a wonderful view of the Canal St. Martin which gave us a glimpse of a Paris we weren't familiar with. Off the beaten track but well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjf666
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this wonderful hotel. The staff is outstanding in every way. The owner is a delight and the Canal St Martin area is a vibrant area - not touristy at all. No problems getting around and there are plenty of great places to eat in the area. Just a delightful stay! And you get an iPad to use during your stay which is really helpful and a classy touch! Breakfast was great too!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week and could not have been happier with our choice of hotel. If you are looking for a touristy hotel near the Louvre or the Eiffel Tower this is not your hotel. But if you are looking for a real Parisian experience in a really great part of the city Le Citizen is the place to stay. We stayed in the Zen Suite on the 6th floor and it was a great room, quiet, clean and stylish. We ate breakfast at the hotel every morning and the croissants are to die for! I am not a coffee drinker but my husband is and he said that the coffee was really great! The service in the hotel is exceptional - including frequent visits by Sophie the owner of the hotel who is a true gem. Each member of her staff is beyond friendly and helpful. This was our second trip to Paris and it really was made more memorable by our decision to stay out in the Canal St Martin area. You really will feel like you are a local rather than a tourist which is the best way to travel! There are many great restaurants in walking distance and several Metro stops are also very close. And you are within walking distance to the Marais which is a wonderful area to wander about for hours. I cannot say enough positive things about this hotel and the next time we are in Paris I will stay here without even looking for another hotel. And as for some of the other reviews that make the area seem like it is gritty and full of homeless people that is just not the case. It is where people live, rather than a tourist area and reminds me of SoHo in NYC. We did not see any homeless people at all during our stay and never felt like we were in a questionable neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and very friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Duncanwhatever
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent 3 night stay in a Zen suite with 2 adults and 1 child. The standard of the hotel was everything promised on the web site and the staff were very friendly and accomodating. We enjoyed the area of Canal St. Martin and down into La Marais very much. We would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed!”
Reviews.Author: nzwayfarer
Reviews.Content: This hotel has only 12 rooms but what it lacks in size - it makes up in service and style. The rooms are not huge but they are beautifully decorated and laid out. Most overlook the canal in an up and coming part of Paris. The little touches count here - free bottled water - free wifi - a free ipad! A delicious reasonably priced breakfast can be had in the room or the small lounge adjoining reception. Minor flaws for some might be the fact that after breakfast, room service is not offered (though there are a number of very good restaurants and cafes nearby) and the locale - within walking distance of most of Paris' essential sights yet not in the main tourist area.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous service from unexceptionally friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jbpdx
Reviews.Content: We spent three days on arrival in France at Le Citizen. From the moment we arrived until we departed we were treated with thoughtfulness and care.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HolidazeLondon
Reviews.Content: As other reviews have stated, this is a nice hotel, with management doing their best to make your stay enjoyable and to be helpful. Room was however very small situated on 1st floor and some noise from the road was experienced because traffic queues at the traffic lights outside the hotel. Disagree with over reviews that there is no traffic noise, but apart from this, a pleasant stay, with a nice few touches such as slippers provided!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & boutique chic!”
Reviews.Author: Tombina
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Zen room with our 3-year old, and loved it! The hotel staff was extremely helpful with any request at all, and the hotel is as beautiful and clean as it seems in the photographs. We now see why people rave about the beds...ours was SO comfortable! The canal was lively with people on Friday & Saturday nights, but we slept peacefully in the room. The little touches are amazing...the types of books in the room as well as in the café, the artwork on display, the modular cushion banquette by the window, the "magic washcloths", and the homemade jams & other treats at the continental breakfast. (The breakfast isn't especially cheap but it's SO worth it!!) The use of an iPad was another perk. The hotel website is extremely useful...Sophie updates it regularly and it has excellent suggestions for shopping, eating, and wandering. She is always around...sometimes at the front desk, in the café, and even making crêpes for guests on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite boutique hotel in the coolest neighborhood in Paris”
Reviews.Author: pullittogether
Reviews.Content: If you want a big room, don't stay here. But if you want a super-comfy bed, incredible service, fabulous neighborhood restaurants, and a wonderful assortment of lively shops, galleries, and sights, Le Citizen is your kind of place. This 12-room hotel opened in October 2010, and the owners are provide patrons with a unique experience off the beaten tourist path. They are always on the lookout for exceptional opportunities in dining or the arts, and they're just immensely pleasant people as well. Service is exceptional. The staff worked some kind of magic to help us through a dry cleaning emergency on the eve of a big night out. Friends who wanted to provide us with a special welcome asked the manager to have flowers in our room; we were greeted by the prettiest bouquet I have ever seen. The owners strive to keep paper use to a minimum and provide each room with an iPad as well as ecologically responsible amenities. (Love the Magic Tissue!) The Canal St. Martin is a focal point for conversation groups, social justice advocates, and families, and it provides a vibrant backdrop to this neighborhood. Stay here if you want an exceptional Parisian adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharron N
Reviews.Content: Great design and good service in a fabulous location right next to a canal. We totally enjoyed our stay and the little special touches. Wifi was great and the iPad to borrow. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A Pearl in the Huitre Parisienne!”
Reviews.Author: capitalstraveller
Reviews.Content: Small, but perfectly formed, and with very smart new decor, this hotel is bound to please; especially when you add in the extremely pleasant and helpful staff, and the bonus of an iPad for the duration of the stay. Despite small identity crises (signs named the hotel variously as "Le Hotel du Canal", "Le Citizen", and, in a remnant of a previous existence as a Japanese restaurant, as "Petit Usagi"), this hotel competes with 500 or so others in the same class in Paris, but must be awarded the yellow jersey, by us at least. There are two rooms (one large and one smaller) on each of six floors, and with a bright reception and breakfast area at street level. For the larger rooms ("zen suites") there is a choice of either bath or walk-in shower, depending on preference and availability: we stayed in zen suite no 33, which had three windows overlooking the adjacent canal: very attractive in the daytime, and a magnet for student picnics in the evening. Breakfast was more than adequate and charmingly served, and we hear that there are plans to include cafe facilities for the lunchtime trade. And we'll never forget the kindness of La Patronne, who made a trip to a late-night Pharmacy to obtain a knee-bandage, for which we were never charged! All-in-all, this is one of the most pleasant hotels in this class which we have stayed in, any where in the world: don't hesitate to try it (but remembering that it is small, not very central, and with some space limitations).

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: cruizin42
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at this lovely hotel - tucked away from the bustle of the centre of Paris but within easy metro reach of the city. We spent 3 full days seeing all of the Paris sites but each afternoon we were very pleased to return to the Hotel. Nestled in a leafy superb right beside the Canal St Martin - this was exactly what we had hoped our Paris stay would be. The staff always made us very welcome and ensured that our stay as a pleasant and "hassle free" one. We dined each night at the Hotel du Nord - 50 metres from the Hotel. Here again we were welcomed like locals. All of the staff looked after us - speaking English and helping us to learn some French along the way. All in all our Paris stay was just "the best". If you want the true experience we recommend you stay at the Hotel Le Citizen.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel - a real gem!”
Reviews.Author: couple75
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel beautifully positioned on the canalside. We were breaking our journey in Paris for one night so chose this hotel for its location close to Gare de L'Est. Our City Room was 'small but perfectly formed' and had absolutely everything that you could possibly want thoughtfully and stylishly stored in the room. The furniture and materials were very modern, crisp and clean. We were given an I-Pad set up ready for us to use - this was such a helpful addition to our stay. The hotel's owner and his staff were really helpful and genuinely friendly - our breakfast waiter deserves a special mention, what an asset to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really good stay”
Reviews.Author: GobblerDictum
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just what we needed. After a short walk from the Gare De L'Est we were warmly welcomed by Pierre on reception. He was happy, friendly and very helpful. He gave us an ipad2 to use during our stay which had lots of apps to help find things around the hotel. He also made loads of recomendations for restaurants and bars nearby. We ate at one of these, the Hotel Du Nord, and really enjoyed it. Our room was small but clean and comfortable with a stylish modern design and a view over the canal. The Canal St Martin area is slightly seedy but it also has a real buzz. The canal sides were lined with (mainly) young people and there was a nice lively atmosphere. The breakfast room was small but bright and airy and the breakfast was good too. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, convenient, and lovely hotel - we hope to return!”
Reviews.Author: BostonTraveler30
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Le Citizen. The rooms are well-appointed, the beds comfortable, the hotel very clean, and the staff exceptional. I hesitated to write this review, only because I fear that once Le Citizen becomes well-known, it will be hard to get a reservation! However, I could not fail to give Le Citizen its due. A hotel that's modern and charming. An unusual combination!

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love this place.”
Reviews.Author: puilam
Reviews.Content: We chose this area of Paris to get away from the high concentration of tourists in the more popular spots, and we are sooooo glad we did. From the window of our Zen suite, we were able to watch the canal boats go by, the locals rushing home with baguettes in hand, and the young party goers hanging out - very entertaining. I agree with all the positive points in previous reviews so no need to repeat here. Do not miss walking along the canal and sampling the local restaurants. We only stay in boutique hotels and this one, by far, is our favourite - it's all in the details and we appreciate every one of them here. It is not quiet on weekends due to street noise so I recommend ear plugs. The bed is so comfortable anyway no-one should have trouble sleeping. We did encounter the local street people who camp out in front sometimes, and the "dirt" that some reviewers have mentioned - but this is Paris, you can't avoid drunks, litter, doggy doo, or graffiti.

Reviews.Title: “A base to explore a different side of Paris”
Reviews.Author: catie2000
Reviews.Content: We were travelling to Berlin via London and stayed here one night as a base close to both stations, and near to Le Marais area. Service and welcome excellent as was loan of iPad, fittings and decor good quality, bathroom high standard but compact. Room a little on the small side. Great area, locals congregate along the canal in Summer, lots of bars and restaurants which are more authentic than on the tourist trail nearer to the centre. Interesting shops and markets close by, and easy walk to the galleries and museums in Le Marais quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place in Paris at affordable price”
Reviews.Author: mde14
Reviews.Content: Imagine the result when you enter into a new hotel with modern decoration , high tech service (all info on a personal IPad for each room) and only 12 rooms, personalized service and huge room just in front of one of the most romantic place in Paris. We really appreciated to find this special hotel, the best one we have ever tested in more than 20 trips in Paris, especially for a very attractive price even for the suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, Great service, very innovative”
Reviews.Author: Si_Botak
Reviews.Content: To be perfectly honest, if I was going to identify where I think Le Citizen's true niche lies, I'd say it actually makes an ideal business hotel than anything... having said that my wife and I loved it regardless and will definitely be back. There are several little things that the hotel does which really made it stand out to my mind... - The staff were very good in terms of their general service and friendliness (Pierre was exceptional). - The staff provided excellent advice about local places to eat, which considering my wife and I are foodies, was very important. Also importantly, they were honest about comparing their own food options to surrounding ones, even if it meant that they might not get our custom downstairs as regularly as they may have done if they plugged their own eatery to us more aggressively. - The FREE wireless is something which can be rare in European hotels. Here it's not just free "in the lobby", it's in the rooms as well. - The complimentary iPad on request? Good move. Not only does it provide an extra service for the customer, it allows a great opportunity to flog partner's goods and services via Apps, allow referential trade etc. Good extra touch in terms of service provided to guests, but also a very canny marketing/business move as well. - Free calls to landlines anywhere in the world. These guys are obviously utilising VoIP. Really surprised more hotels don't do this. In regards to the Rooms... - The rooms are small, but they are very clean, well maintained, and the IKEA style furnishings make for a stylish (if somewhat unorthodox) decor that is comfortable if it requires an allowance for something a bit different from the usual. - The bathrooms are again something a bit different. Drainage of water due to the bathroom design is something that, to be honest, may bother other guests, although it certainly didn't bother us. The requirement to leave linen on the floor if it requires changing was another small difference, but this was clearly communicated by the staff. - I've read a review saying the bed was small? We actually found the bed to be comfortable, large enough for both my wife and myself (My wife is a small/medium framed woman by Western Standards... I'm not a small guy by anyone's :) ) - I'd suggest that someone unused to urban sounds may be disturbed at night if they sleep with the windows open. It was the tail end of winter, so we had the windows closed at night, and slept quite peacefully... - The decor seems to suggest an emphasis on style and modernity rather than traditional luxury/comfort. This means the rooms may not be to your taste, so bear this in mind. Having said that, we were never uncomfortable. - My wife does not drink tap water as a rule, so the filtered water which was replenished daily allowed us to keep out water bottles topped up whilst out and about which was nice. I didn't care for the mineral water provided, but this is a more of a personal taste thing on my part as I'm not into Mineral water - nothing to do with the hotel there... Overall a very pleasant if simple hotel.... as I said one gets the sense of it having a niche more as a business hotel than a traditional couples or leisure hotel, but the friendliness of the staff, good location well covered by the Metro network, nearby cafes, restaurants and patisseries, and some of the little extras they provide make it a good choice for a leisure type hotel regardless... especially given some of the horror stories floating around about Parisian hotels not being worth the money. We paid a bit extra on this hotel compared to some of the other places we stayed at in Europe, but were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “***********”
Reviews.Author: vanduyn
Reviews.Content: :-) The most friendly staff we have ever met. :-)The quality of the (simple) breakfast is fantastic (home made marmelade, the best bread of paris, excellent tea .. ° :-( rooms are tiny

Reviews.Title: “Little Oaisis in Off-Beat Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: TRV_1957
Reviews.Content: My wife, adult daughter and I spent three nights in one of the Zen Suites. Very modern, IKEA-styled furnishings. Extremely comfortable bed and bedding. Quiet and effective AC, along with windows that open wide, allowed for fresh air during the day and sound insulation at night. Bathroom very nicely appointed, if a bit small (but not so for Paris), with a great waterfall showerhead. As others have commented, Le Citizen is located in what is still a transitional neighborhood, with few tourists and places catering to them. There was a resident homeless man who habituated the curb right below our window, cursing strangers and being visited by neighborhood pals. My daughter found him intriguing and amusing (from a distance), while I found him annoying. This is not the Rue Cler but a (lower) middle class Paris neighborhood, which is a bit out of the way. That said, the Gare de l'Est is an easy 10 minute walk and the closest single line Metro station about the same. We had breakfast one AM at the hotel, and it was very nice at 12.5 Euros each. The owners and other hotel staff are friendly and helpful. If it were located in the 7th or 8th, it would command a much higher nightly rate.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, a great little find!”
Reviews.Author: RandB2010
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel really delivers, a warm and inviting stay. We hope to return again soon. Pros Big modern room by Parisian standards Newly renovated - small/boutique Very comfortable beds Ipad available for every room - also free wi fi for other devices Good location - near to Republique Metro Helpful friendly staff Cons Area is still quite mixed so theres a few homeless people hanging around near to the hotel which we heard one of the nights Shower is modern but it sprays water all over the floor (This really was a minor concern all in all though)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amato11
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, friendly staff, beautiful decor. For a weekend getaway you can't beat the price and the location. The rooms are large and well furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Wendiii
Reviews.Content: Le Citzen staff made us very welcome from the moment we arrived, there was good conversation, local recommendations and always there if we had any questions. Usually I miss my own bed and shower whilst I'm staying in a hotel but this was treat. We stayed in the Zen Suite and the rain shower was heavenly, better still the super king size bed like we have at home but was even more comfortable, then to be enveloped in big soft feather duvet.... I'd stay there again. They have iPads in the rooms, this was vey handy to look up info for our day ahead, excellent idea. Close to the metro it made dashing around Paris very easy.

Reviews.Title: “A Fresh Hotel Experience for Paris--We Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Hulot_11
Reviews.Content: For the final night of a 2-week dream holiday, we looked for a fresh, new hotel experience in Paris, and we found it at Le Citizen. Contemporary interior design was very much to our taste, as was the interesting, lively surrounding community of Canal St Martin. The reception staff were very helpful, knowledgeable, and likeable. Our room was small, but this was no surprise--it was described accurately on the website. Attention to detail, quality components, and creative use of space made the most of the limited area. We loved our room, our (temporary) IPad, our breakfast, and the nearby restaurant recommended and booked by the reception staff. We didn't want to leave, and we hope to return. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best stays, anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Nimrud69
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great location, great rooms. What more can I say? Staff speak English and are always ready to help. Igor, especially, is great for good recommendations for restaurants. If I'm ever in Paris again, this will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but not for Everyone”
Reviews.Author: fishskis
