Reviews.Content: Le Citizen is a cool, very thoughtfully designed and managed wonderful little unique hotel. But I would not recommend it to everyone. I visit Paris frequently, and I have stayed in many different types of hotels, form the top palaces to small three and four stars in St. Germain, my usual preference. Le Citizen is located in an up and coming "cool" neighborhood, but it is not central to most sights and attractions. I would not recommend this hotel to someone going to Paris for the first time due to its location. if you have been to Paris a few times and want to explore another neighborhood, then yes, this is a great place to stay. It has a hip, young feel, and if you are older, or need to be coddled by hotel staff, I would not recommend this hotel. Though I liked spending a coupe of days in this area, it would not be my preferred location, in general. There are a lot of cool restaurants, bars, and cafes in the area, and the canals are an interesting part of Paris that I had never experienced. The owner has done a fantastic job designing the rooms, and the management, Pierre and the owner specifically, really make this a special place. My "junior suite" was beautifully and intelligently designed; I really credit the owner with originality and smart, thoughtful design touches and very good use of space. Additionally, the technology and electronics were wonderfully designed and perfectly functional. On the downside, my room was noisy during the day due to street noise, but at night, there was no problem at all. The AC was great (which is a huge deal to me), and the bed and bedding fantastic. I was in a handicapped room, and the doorless shower needs to be modified a bit in order to prevent a flooded bathroom floor, but they will figure this out. I loved this hotel, but it is not for everyone; know who you are before you book here.

Reviews.Title: “Most personal hotel we visited”
Reviews.Author: fredde79a
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week at Le Citizen Hotel, Paris, and we can warmly recommend the hotel. The staff is very nice and serviceminded. They helped us arrange anything we asked for, such as reservations at restaurants and recommendations what to see and do in Paris. They made the extra efforts, and they expected nothing in return for their troubles. The room we had was very nice and tidy. The beds were very comfortable and we slept better than we have done for a very long time. The room we had was very modern, clean and had a nice design. The safety deposit was free of charge, as was the WiFi. The breakfast at the hotel was good, we could not find any breakfast at a café including the same menu as at the hotel, at the same price. The hotel is very priceworthy considering the service and the comfort. When we visit Paris the next time, we will make sure to stay at Le Citizen Hotel again. Thank you to everyone in the staff, for making our stay so pleasant. Best regards Kattis & Fredrik

Reviews.Title: “terrific.....”
Reviews.Author: rimaindia
Reviews.Content: loved this hotel....location is great...they were lovely with children(didn't mind them playing on the hotel ipad)....one of the best minibar stocks i have seen not your regular chocolate and peanut stuff...sophie was great.helped me find all my shops and places that we wanted to goto. we stayed at the zen suite which has just enough space needed by a family of 4.rm has been done really well. grt utilisation of space my boys loved looking out of the window as the canal is rt next to the hotel...i would recommend this hotel to anybody who wants to spend a few days in paris and wants stay at a comfortable,stylish and friendly hotel

Reviews.Title: “Over- rated”
Reviews.Author: tyst
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually occupying a very small part of an building, which also heavily restricts its space. Really nice staffs, but you pay 179euros per night to have a very very tiny room on the first floor. Although facing the canal, the noise from the street and next door building can cause poor sleep quality. The bed in the room is actually smaller than the regular queen size bed. I ve been to Paris for many times and been to quite a lot boutique hotels in Europe, but this 179 euros is indefensible for this hotel. I do admire the designer who totally takes advantage of every inch of the space, but it is still not worth it.At least they should improve the sound proof windows. This hotel claims to have complimentary purified water , but it is only a RO purified tap water... a boutique hotel Should offer more(evian,the like). If you still want to stay here, prepare to pay 200 or more, for bigger rooms on upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Paris”
Reviews.Author: P_Arrow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Citizen for 4 nights and couldn't be happier. The hotel itself is perfect. Fantastic location and amazing rooms. But it was Pierre who made our stay something we will never forget. He is so helpful and friendly. We looked forward to our morning breakfasts which he helped prepare. When I go back to Paris I know exactly where I'm going. Le Citizen!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very best”
Reviews.Author: CarlSoeder
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a fantastic location. Great stylish room which we enjoyed very much. Close to good restaurants and boutiques. we visited the close by boutique with jewellery designed by Viveka Bergstrom which was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkeppens
Reviews.Content: Had a great trip to Paris, and were happy to stay in such a great hotel. Clean rooms, friendly staff, and a great breakfast. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “IF YOU WANT BAD CARELESS SERVICE, STAY HERE. OTHERWISE, STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE.”
Reviews.Author: mellowsunny
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a major problems with service and their communication between staffs. Here are 2 of the many incidents we experienced: INCIDENT 1. Prior our stay, we asked them to make a restaurant reservation. They response and made the reservation for us, and we confirmed over email with the date and time. When we arrive to the restaurant 30 mins before our reservation, we realized our table are given to another couple who also stay in Le Citizen. You can imagined how upset my wife and I were as it was our 10th wedding anniversary. We went to the hotel and see what was going on. The owner/manager, Sophie, explained that they called us 45 mins ago, but we didn't response, so they give it to someone else. Seriously 45 mins before dinner?! what logic is that? INCIDENT 2. We have a 7am flight to leave Paris at the last day. We asked Sophie to book a taxi. She recommended us to use their hotel car service to the airport for 50 euro over using a taxi since we are leaving so early in the morning. We agreed and the morning before, we confirmed with the morning staff, Pierre to make sure a car is reserved for the the next morning. He said to us he hasn't order a car because he didn't know where the destination is. After we told him, he said he is going to call the driver. We also requested a morning call for 4am. We assume that is taking care of and we went off to enjoy our last day in Paris. The day we leave, there was no morning call @ 4am, and when we check out the night staff has no clue we had a reserved car. He called the driver and the driver told him that he didn't want to drive so too early in the morning. Long story short, we ended up pay more to order a taxi. So for any future guest, BE AWARED!! the hotel may seem diligent prior to your arrival and offer concierge service... they don't understand the meaning of making a reservation or holding one. You may encounter the very careless service and with plenty of excuses about why your requests cannot be met. Aside from the service, the hotel is clean, beds are comfortable, and in a nice location by St Martin Canal. Rooms are very small with strange layouts.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: mcg2220
Reviews.Content: Le Citizen Hotel is a modern, boutique hotel with a friendly staff and charming location. Upon arrival, we were greeted by two employees who welcomed us to Paris, check us in, and handed us an I-pad that contained helpful information about the hotel and many wonderful restaurants around the neighborhood. The owner, Sophie, was there, with a car service, when we explained we had show tickets and wanted to go to the eiffel tower before it closed. I would highly recommend this hotel and looking forward to returning in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “If you gonna go to Paris you must stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eroht
Reviews.Content: Le Citizen Hotel is really value for money. The staff has a great service attitude and is helpfull with everything. At check-in every room get their own Ipad to use during the stay free of charge.The rooms are fresh and together with location it makes a perfect base for your stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Fun, and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: CitizenMP
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived after a short walk from the nearby metro stop to our last goodbyes we were in love with Paris and Le Citizen Hotel. With great views along the canal and great little restaurants and local businesses, this cool and classy yet fun and accessible hotel is everything needed as a perfect home base while in Paris. The best shower we have every had in our extensive travels was just the beginning. Sophie (the owner) and Roos (at reception) could not have been kinder and more helpful to us (non-native speakers). In fact, during a chat about our evening plans they quickly determined we would not have time to make our second reservation using public transportation arranged to have a car waiting for us when we walked out of our show. Without this kindness we would have missed out completely on our second event of the evening. Did I mention the cool IPAD provided at check-in preloaded with all kinds of cool info? What can I say, Loved it, Loved it, Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “The New York Times is right. Stay in this Paris Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Keeper64
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this incredible little hotel in Paris for two weeks on a photography assignment. It could not have been better. The hotel is located in a Paris neighborhood that must have the highest concentration of world class restaurants and cafe's in Paris and Sophie the owner of Le Citizen will send you to the right food destination. Just follow her recommendations and you will not be disappointed. We certainly were not. The hotel is new on the inside with great personality on the outside. The website photos are, if anything, understating the charm of this hotel. The showers are large and powerful. The beds are extremely comfortable but most important of all the staff treat you like a member of their own family. One of their staff even bought us a little present on her way to work! The neighborhood is pure Parisian without the overwhelming tourist crowds (and tourist predators) to worry about, yet all of the major museums are very convenient. I would not consider staying anywhere else on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Charming”
Reviews.Author: MamaBean80
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from a wonderful six night stay at the Le Citizen Hotel du Canal Paris. This charming boutique hotel, which opened last October. Is located on the St. Martin Canal. The neighbourhood has lots of trees, parks and restaurants nearby. We walked to many parts of the city but if you choose to use the Metro, the nearest stop is less than a five minute walk. Our room overlooked this scenic canal. The local residents use the canal extensively to relax and socialize. Our room was compact but very well appointed with a safe. bar fridge and a very comfortable bed. The only issue some people might have is that the City D rooms have limited closet space, but they do have larger rooms as well. They also provided free wifi internet service including the free use of an I-Pad to keep in touch with family back home. The hotel is very chic and modern with a cheerful breakfast room. They provide a very ample breakfast with lovely fresh bread, croissants, homemade jams and yogurt, freshly squeezed orange juice, and granola. They can also cook eggs if you prefer a hot breakfast…..all for a reasonable fee. We were most impressed with the staff. Pierre, Igor, Ally, and Rose were outstanding, always helpful and friendly…a credit to the owner, Sophie, for recognizing their competent professionalism. We look forward to returning to this “home away from home” and highly recommended it. David and Carole Waterloo, Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “We only stayed one night, but wish it would have been more!”
Reviews.Author: Ruubee
Reviews.Content: Such a refreshing place t o stay! The staff was super friendly and helpful, and the little things were so nice-- i.e. water was offered as we waited to check in; water in the room (for free!); an ipad with all sorts of helpful hints given to you upon arrival and a nice, big comfy bed. The view of the Canal was lovely, albeit a bit loud, but we didn't mind at all. Would definitely come back..

Reviews.Title: “great hotel clean and comfortable great location”
Reviews.Author: womble32
Reviews.Content: our family of 5 stayed at le citizen for 5 nights and loved it we had a family room which was 2 ajoining rooms, while space was limited it usually is with 5 people, the hotel is clean, beds are comfortable it has a lift, has 24hr desk. staff are great and very helpful woul stronly recommend, also is on the canal which is terrific atmosphere, also rate is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel - Will come back here again”
Reviews.Author: Tinasik
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Le Citizen. It's a beautifully decorated hotel in a great area - trendy neighborhood with a nearby metro. Walking distance to Marais. There are many restaurants around, we went to the one recommended by the hotel and had a marvelous experience - and the best part was that there were no other tourists. The room we had was small, but the hotel made best use of the space with the set up of furniture. It would be ideal for a single traveler, but also worth the value for a couple. Pierre, the concierge was very helpful & friendly. The hotel was modern & high tech (FREE WIFI!!!!) We got an iPad, however it was in french and it was locked, so we couldn't change the language. I'm sure that if we asked the staff to download something in particular for us they would've, but we hadn't bothered. Also, VERY good coffee for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly French experience in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JD1155
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so different from others we have tried in Paris. It is fresh, contemporary, light and stylish. Yet there is a genuine warmth and friendliness in the staff. Because the hotel is small, you feel you are part of the local neighbourhood when you stay. It is surrounded by small restaurants and cafes all to adding to the local feel. The hotel is also in walking distance to the major railway stations. I would highly recommend this Le Citizen.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a local”
Reviews.Author: phoenixflyers
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel overlooking the canal. Modern, clean and comfortable with helpful pleasant staff. Located a 5 minute walk from the nearest Metro in an area with lots of cool cafes and near the places the locals shop; just far enough away from the tourist bustle to be fun & refreshing without being inconvenient. Room was tiny (typical for Paris?) but comfortable - could be a problem for people who are untidy; shower was great. Liked everything about the place and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great personal service!”
Reviews.Author: frkglans
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice experience! The room was small, as expected, but every detail of it, from the sparkling water to the magiq towel, and conditioner in the shower, was exquisite! The owner, the wonderful Sophie, was ever-present and super helpfull and friendly. the breakfast was superb, but the champagne bottle we got from them to enjoy at the canal was pricey. The location is great, and we had som really good meals nearby: At La Verre Volé and Chez Philou. All in all, a superb hotel-experience! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Finally found a hotel in Paris we would go back to”
Reviews.Author: robclark-London
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paris countless times and each time we've stayed in a different area of Paris and at a different hotel. We've tried small hotels and the chain hotels. Le Citizen is a small hotel of just 12 rooms and a small restaurant area. The hotel is wonderfully location on Canal St Martin, right next to one of the swing bridges and lock gates. You have a great view of the boats going up and down which was exciting for the children. This area is very residential so you won't see many other tourists. The nearest station is Jacques Bonsergent (L5) or its only a 10 minute walk (with children) to Republique one of the best connected metro stations in Paris. From Gare du Nord it was a comfortable 15 minute walk with luggage in tow. Form the moment you arrive you are made to feel at home. We mainly dealt with Pierre during our stay, one of the most friendly Parisiens we have ever met. However, all the staff at this hotel were really friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The room itself was lovely. We had a citizen apartment - which is basically an adjoining room and suite. This gave us two bathrooms. In the suite there were some large cushions for customisable seating - or for making dens if you are a child! Great fun - see the video on the hotel website. Like most hotels in Paris, the room was not huge, but it was more than adequate for our needs and felt large due to the brilliant way in which it had been laid out. Sound proofing was ideal. We heard no street noise other than the occasional siren. This was great given the number of locals sitting canal side with guitars etc until the early hours. We slept well with no noise disturbance. The ipads (there is one per room) are a great touch! Really helpful in helping you to plan your day as well as find out all you need to know about the hotel. We only ate breakfast once at the hotel. The service was great and the croissants were wonderful. A slight mix up over the eggs was dealt with promptly and efficiently and was actually quite funny! Pierre had even made the thoughtful touch to order some pain au chocolat for our children. Le Citizen felt unique. Nice touches, welcome homely feel, picturesque location and great service. After many trips, we've finally found a hotel we'd gladly return too and we can't wait to book our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Kindness, like a boomerang, always returns. ~Author Unknown”
Reviews.Author: TessMcCarthy1
Reviews.Content: Kindness, like a boomerang, always returns. ~Author Unknown I heard this quote in yoga class a few days I got back from Europe and I think it's appropriate of the treatment we received at Le Citizen. I can't begin to tell you all the kindness we got...so much so, I've re-written this review a few times. At any rate, Le Citizen rates one of the best deals in Paris in terms of price, value, service, convenience and style! Location Le Citizen is located in the 10th arrondissement of Paris which is right above Le Marais (3rd arrondissement) on the Right Bank and east side of the city. The hotel rests along the Canal St. Martin and it's so nice to wake up and peek out the hotel window and watch the world unfold in front of your eyes. At various times of the day, the Canal is quiet, alive, chatty and festive. We were exhausted our first night and rested in our loft like Zen Suite bed and fell asleep to the sounds locals engaging in conversation and drink. It was as if I were in one of Renoir’s paintings, "Luncheon of the Boating Party." Next time we go, we'll pack more energy and chill along the canal like the locals do. I felt as if we were missing out on a lot of fun. It took me a little over 25 minutes to get from the Louvre (1st arrondissement) to Quai Jemmappes. That being said, it is very accessible. It's close to a Metro station and just right outside the door is a Velib station--where you can rent bikes for the day/week. We thought that Velib wouldn't accept our American credit card [because we read an article that European credit cards have a chip (ICC integrated chip) and use a pin] but the owner of the hotel told me it took American cards and viola! It did! :) Room Le Citizen comes equipped with a purposeful iPad which you may or may not find helpful. It was packed with recommendations, apps and of course, the guide to the hotel. Very green! Speaking of green: you use your hotel key to activate the wattage/lighting in the room near the front. That way you only fire up electricity when you are there or really need it. Our room was tidied up every day and the bed--so comfy. I loved the bottled water, the body lotion (that I accidentally used on my hair) and the small things that just made everything so neat. We stayed in one of the Zen suites and it was really felt as if you were staying at your very cool Aunt and Uncle's Paris apartment: with it comes a great view, a well stocked mini bar, a cozy nest-like bed and, lots of respect for the people who help you along the way. That being said, everyone was VERY NICE! One day, my partner and I got separated in the Louvre and I talked to the information kiosk and asked if my partner made her way to the hotel (Le Citizen). I called a second time because I couldn't find her and the proprietress got on the phone with me and asked if I wanted the car service to pick me up! I felt very taken care of. And, the car service, by the way, is the way to go (if you want to get to the hotel). The driver was sweet and waited for us (even though our train was delayed from Brussels). Food We didn't get a chance to try out the Japanese food there, but, I have to pinch myself for not smuggling the hotel owner's homemade raspberry jam! She casually said she hoped we liked it--LOVED IT! Incredible woman! Very down to earth, humble, classy. Advice So, the only advice I have for you is to be nice to these people! They have been nothing but the best and I'd hate to come across a review that was off-handedly rude. It would break my heart. Seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay: Beautiful Hotel with an even better staff!”
Reviews.Author: theworldcalls
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous boutique hotel in a beautiful area of Paris called Canal St Martin. We stayed for 7 nights in "La City L" room during April 2011. We really enjoyed the hotel, the staff and the area. The hotel is beautifully decorated, with simplicity without ever venturing into boring (it has lots of style, and it has been featured in many architecture & design magazines). It is quite small, it has only 12 rooms; but the room we were in was a perfect size (Not small at all for European standards). We fitted comfortably with our 4 large suitcases. The bed is a really comfortable large double, with a plush duve. The bathroom is quite spacious and 2 people can easily maneuver in it (the bathroom amenities are quite a delight as well!). The hotel sits right beside the canal, so you get canal views from the windows. If that's not enough you also get an IPAD to use in your room with high speed internet! Canal St. Martin is a very relaxed neighborhood, filled with lots of artsy and trendy locals. You hardly see any tourists at all (after been in Paris for a while you will be VERY grateful of this). Around the hotel you have various cafes, bars and restaurants (Hotel du Nord, Chez Prune). There are also trendy shops like Agnes B, Maje, A.P.C. just up the street. There are a couple of supermarkets really close by and 2 metro stations a couple blocks away. The highlight of the stay here though has to be the staff! They were incredibly attentive and lovely. They made us feel welcome and went out of their way to help us (with restaurant suggestions and reservations, car rentals, directions and even fix reservation mistakes we had made at other hotels in France!)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, with small rooms - good location and service”
Reviews.Author: Finland.Helsinki
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a really good stay at the hotel. The bed, shower, design were excellent. The standard rooms are really small but since we were there to enjoy Paris and only slept in the room. The soundproofing was poor too. An American lady next door did have a really interesting phone call at midnight. We heard every word until we banged loud enough to shut her up! Sophie (owner), Pierre and Igor (staff) were all good people who were really helpful and made our stay memorable. Pierre knows his restaurants... A nice four day stay alongside the St. Martin Canal.

Reviews.Title: “classy, clean and close to where you wanna be”
Reviews.Author: mauro_guarise
Reviews.Content: the rooms are classy & modern in an urban way, the people are very helpful and the location is superb especially for people looking to live in the hipper region around st. martin and bellevile. close to a couple of good bistrots. the receptionist makes reservations in selected restaurants well in advance for her guests, so you might be the one to be placed in a good spot withouth having to care to make phone calls (like us). check out the "cambodga" around the corner for its great food or the hotel du nord to enjoy modern french cuisine while watching all the hipsters come and go. 10 min walk to gare de l'est.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TBB1
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on other reviews and we were not disappointed. The staff were excellent - very friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. We were given a very warm welcome and coffee on arrival and offered local knowledge and help with resevervations at restaurants and events. It's well worth booking the tranfer from Gare du Nord/airport through the hotel. The Zen suite on the 6th floor was a great room, light and spacious with the comfiest bed and best shower! The Canal St Martin is a great area with cafes, bars and restaurants, away from the very overcrowded tourist areas, half an hour to 40 minutes leisurely stroll to Montmatre, Pere Lachaise cemetary, the Marias area and the Seine. The Carillon bar on the corner of Rue Alibert about 5 minutes walk is a good, relaxed place for a beer and have live music on a Saturday evening. The canal side on a Saturday evening was a favourite place for local people to gather for picnics and had a great atmosphere. We would definitely return to this hotel and recommend the area as a good base for exploring Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Regelmatige_reiziger
Reviews.Content: It was a great pleasure to stay in Le Citizen Hotel. The rooms are very comfortable and the beds are from the best quality. The neighborhood is very interesting and not to touristic. The personal interest of the owners and staff is very warm and helpful. All the guest get an iPad at arrival which gives you as a guest a lot of comfort, makes it easy to check surrounding and what to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gab0206
Reviews.Content: Friendly hotel in a great spot by the canal. Rooms were modern and well designed, check in and out was quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: fadochicago
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our six night stay in the Le Citizen hotel and absolutely loved it. The Zen Suite on the 3rd floor overlooked the Canal and provided plenty of space to stretch out while enjoying the view. The boats going through the locks of the canal were very cool to see once or twice a day from our comfy perch. The bathroom had the added benefit of having a rain shower with good water pressure and plenty of hot water, which had been hit or miss on stays in other French hotels. Overall our room was well designed with a good size, for Europe, seating area, plenty of space for storage and a relaxing atmosphere. The hotel is very well located, being about a 5 minute walk from the Jacques Bonsergent and 7-10 minute walk from the Republique metro stops. From these it is a short ride to any of the major sites within in Paris. There are numerous cafes within walking distance and a great little bakery down Rue Lancry which is fantastic for a morning snack before hopping on the Metro. My wife and I thought the iPads were a good addition, keeping us minimally connected to the world and providing an Angry Bird fix if needed. The staff was incredibly friendly and responsive to any needs we had. They ensured our stay was very comfortable and hassle free. We recommend this hotel very highly and can’t wait to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic friendly service in small boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: cartslang
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my daughter (10) and her friend and mother. We had one of the family apartments (there are 2 one on the 5th and 6th floor). Great decor, comfortable beds and the girls loved the chill out area and the ipads! The staff here fall over themselves to be helpful and friendly. They made a huge effort to find us a restaurant on Sunday night which isn't always straightforward in Paris. We walked to and from the hotel from the Eurostar terminal (about 15mins). It's not far to the Gare de L'est metro station which has good connections but the girls were fine walking to the Marais and to and from Hotel de Ville. The owner is often around and has great tips on things to do in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We have found 'our' hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LievenClaeys
Reviews.Content: It isn't easy to find a hotel for a family with 3 kids in Paris. Le Citizen have good solution for that. The collaborators are very friendly and helpfull. To have an ipad in the room is very usefull to prepare the visits in the city. The area is very quite and with enough shops and restaurant to have a good stay. The metro is very near and the real centre of Paris is on a few minutes with the metro. The room was very clean and pratical. We really enjoy the stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Pure bliss!”
Reviews.Author: silvietta64
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel through Trip Advisor because of the location (overlooking canal st. Martin) and the pics of the rooms, very spacious (unusual in Paris) and furnished in a ''Japanese'' style. We were not disappointed: our room, a Zen suite on the sixth floor, was perfect, full of light, comfortable, quiet, with a breath-taking view of che canal and the roofs around. The owners were both nice, helpful, ready yo give advice and good suggestions especially regarding restaurants. We will definitely come back here and warmly suggest this hotel to all couples looking for a perfect place to spend a romantical escape.....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jmb1999
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a very enjoyable short break to Paris. This hotel is a rare find. The location is perfect, with the metro a short walk away and the velib bicycles 20m away. We were able to hop on the bicycles and cycle straight into the city centre in 20 minutes - very enjoyable. The area is non touristy and very french, with a handful of very good local cafes and restaurants within 100m of the hotel. The staff are very helpful, the rooms well designed, soundproofed from street and immaculate. Ipads were a nice touch. We did not avail of the breakfast but in hindsight we really should have as it was good value and in a lovely setting which would have set us up nicely for the cycle into town. Well designed, very safe, great location, lovely staff, very clean and comfortable - in short Perfect. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone and we can't wait to get back again for another short break.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a Heart - Cool, Chic, Cosy in a Charming Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: sclzg
Reviews.Content: My partner and I wanted to discover a new side of Paris. And finding this hotel was the icing on the cake. Canal St. Martin even in grrrrr cold December has so much charm and warmth. Le Citizen Hotel with its very personalized and really caring service made us feel so "at home". A Boutique Hotel at its best. Great Price, Great Location, Excellent Service. We look forward to spending a Parisienne Spring or Summer here...

Reviews.Title: “pure bliss”
Reviews.Author: francaisdelondres
Reviews.Content: I was stranded in Paris two nights by ice and snow and a friend recommended I try this new little hotel on the canal St. Martin. That has truly saved the day. Not only this is one of my favorite quartiers in Paris, but waking up blessed with such beautiful (snowy) views of the canal has made me forget my shouting arguments with Eurostar personnel and that I ought to go back to London. I have attached a picture of what Sophie - the delightful and ever-helpful hostess - has prepared for me on my third trip back from the Gare du Nord (the hotel is conveniently 15mn walk from the station). Everything is lovely and thought through, and made to be felt like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in a stylish boutique hotel where "locals" flock to - for a less touristy and more enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_in_France
Reviews.Content: On a previous visit to Paris, we discovered the Canal Saint-Martin area. A "tres" hip area that is popular with Parisians but where few tourists venture. It's unfortunate - but at the same time if the tour buses started to arrive - it would lose its charm. In the spring and summer you will find lots of locals flocking to the banks of the Canal St. Martin. Couples pushing baby carriages, people riding bikes, and simply sitting in a Cafe or along the canal watching the boats go by. To learn more about the Canal St. Martin and the area, take a look at this video: http://www.geobeats.com/videoclips/france/paris/canal-st-martin On our latest visit, we decided to try the new Le Citizen hotel directly on the Canal and recently opened this fall. Wonderful experience! Although it is located away from the tourist crowds, it is a short metro ride to all the major tourist areas of Paris. Comfortable beds, chic design, and accommodating staff (yes in Paris!). For the price (remember this is Paris) we found this hotel to be fantastic value. Stylish design + Comfortable beds + Reasonable Price + Great location = GREAT STAY If your thinking of going, book ahead as this is a small hotel, about a dozen rooms, and I'm certain it will fill up quickly as more people learn about it.
